SENSES.SENSE: a set of facts and arguments that you can state for or against something<font color=blue> ex: This horrible crime strengthens the case of those who want all guns to be licensed . </font>
an example or instance of something<font color=blue> ex: In the majority of cases, keeping a project within budget depends on efficient cost control. </font>
a situation or set of conditions, especially one involving a particular person or thing<font color=blue> ex: Often, as is the case for these families, there is no other source of support. </font>
a situation or person to be dealt with, often by an official<font color=blue> ex: There have been several reports of cases of neglected and abused children. </font>
a container or cover for keeping or protecting something<font color=blue> ex: The paintings were shipped in large wooden cases. </font>
a form of a noun, adjective, or pronoun in some languages that shows its relationship in grammar to other words in a sentence
a legal matter that will be decided in a court<font color=blue> ex: The assistant district attorney informed the judge that he had completed the case for the prosecution. </font>
